6lGDhxbtCysrMgD9B7PT6Q.text: I have been walking pass Angus House umpteenth times but never has the chance to step in until just this year. It was a celebration meal for a birthday and finally we had the chance to explore Angus House. Angus House is quite easy to locate as she is on the 4th Level of Takashimaya, next to the Toys / Children Department .I quite like this open concept kitchen part of the restaurant whereby we were able to take a click preview of the chef busying in the kitchen.Internally is well lited, under the spacious and romantic lights, environment makes it cozy and relaxing. With attentive servers around, I would say that their service is prompt and smiley.It is perfect place for a first date. Also, it is recommended to make reservation and secure a seat.We were there for steak but to make it a meal with appetizer, soup, salad, bread and dessert, we topped up $15 each and find it quite worthy.Appetizer was a big piece of salmon with flaky bread stick and sweet sauce.Reminds of my Mos Burger Style of Salad and immediately I know they are common as its Japanese! Greens was crunchy with cherry tomato, Japanese cucumber, corn kernels, cabbages and dressed with roasted sesame sauce.We had the escargot as our sides. Well baked with herbs and butter, served sizzling hot. I'm not really a fan of these shells but I think the style of preparation were rather fragrant. Escargot - $18You can still hear the sizzling and bubbling effect of butter together with escargot when they serve to the table.Close up of EscargotEnvironment was quite cold and just right with a warm bowl of calm chowder.Calm ChowderIngredients in Calm ChowderThis is not the usual Western Style Steak I had. In case you are not aware, Angus House is mainly serving Japanese Style Beef Steak as well as pasta and the type of serving may not be what you have on mind if you are thinking along Morton's Style.The 200g Sirloin Steak comes in a sizzling hot plate direct from the kitchen in Medium-Well doneness as requested. A piece of savoury herb butter and slice of lemon was placed on the steak, as the heat rises, the butter melts accordingly. Steak was definitely soft and texture was friendly with the knife.Sirloin Steak 200g - $60While the man had a bigger portion of 300g Steak from the Rib Eye at Medium doneness. Similarly, the steak was juicy and tender just like I had my Sirloin.Rib Eye Steak 300g - $78Desserts have option of Cheese Cake or Tiramisu. Since we are having 2 sets, we opted for both and ended our dinner with sweet endings. Cheese cake came with a very moist biscuit base and was light in taste, not too cloying. I love the Cereal and the dash of raspberry sauce and cream by the side.dCheese CakeTiramisu was light and tasty coupled with honey melon, dragonfruit, mint leaf and strawberry. It was real good and in fact I dont mind having another piece if they do offer.TiramisuAt least I can strike off the To Visit / To Eat from my list after visiting Angus House. The quality of food and service are commendable. I won't hesitate to recommend my friends here if they want to try Japanese Style Beef.

photos.caption: Photo of Angus House - Singapore, Singapore. Yummy Escargot
Photo of Angus House - Singapore, Singapore. Escargot
Photo of Angus House - Singapore, Singapore. Calm Chowder, soup of the day

d2gp6mXYppt8lH3bPWkXZQ.text: We each ordered a set that came with a starter, bun, main and dessert. On weekdays there is free tea/coffee but not on weekends.Starter: Threadfin fish on a bed of mashed potatoSalad - nice too.Best bun! Soft and warm.Cream of mushroom soup - good, not heavy.Sirloin steak - good, just as I had ordered. Far better than the one at Wooloomooloo.Corn on the cob - Super lousy, tasteless & hard.Guava mousse cake - never had this before but it's nice. Their most popular dessert is tiramisu. The other choice was ice cream.Overall a very good meal.Reasonably priced for the quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Angus House - Singapore, Singapore. Guava mousse cake
Photo of Angus House - Singapore, Singapore. Tenderloin 200 gm
Photo of Angus House - Singapore, Singapore. Salad

Wb4FxiPeHis1kteANWWbtQ.text: This is one of my favorite steak house in singapore. Consistent quality of food and consistent nice service. Good for family and business. Great location.

X4CITHFtt4sMySfbZnOFfA.text: My family has been coming here for years. Angus House serves Japanese style steaks and pastas. We always get the set since it's a great deal (you'd get an appetizer, soup, salad, dessert to go with your mains), and make a special request for the corn soup and extra sauce for the steaks. If you like Japanese style pastas, you should also check them out. Their sea- urchin and scallop spaghetti makes for great comfort food.

photos.caption: Photo of Angus House - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Angus House - Singapore, Singapore. Spaghetti with abalone and salmon roe
Photo of Angus House - Singapore, Singapore

pGUc_yZOUCOWPJklmoV_dQ.text: The Food: We got the set for all of these mains (below). The set includes a salad, prawn spring roll & breaded prawns starters (the prawn spring roll came out a little cold though) , soup (lobster chowder - love it!) for an additional $10. 1. Spaghetti salmon row & abalone set $33- A fusion of east & west! The salmon row and abalone was topped off with seaweed strips :) - Overall ok. 2. Chicken grill $38- Loved it! The chicken was so tender and succulent! They grill it and serve it on a hotplate. - A generous portion was given too. 3. Tenderloin steak (medium well) $57- The beef was not over cooked, definitely juicy which was good. I had mine medium well so I was happy they didn't over cook it like most places. - Portion wise it was small. Service: Good. Very efficient (even on a friday night). Ambiance: A colonial yet modern & clean cut setting (very korean drama serial). The servers had to wear a french-maid like outfit (not the sexy kind, mind you) but it was still a bit strange to see the restaurant have its staff wear such uniforms. I can't imagine the servers like it much? I guess it contributes to the overall theme of the restaurant? Though I would stil eat there even without the french-maid uniforms being worn. It's definitely about the food & service. Tip: this place serves THE BEST BREAD! It's freshly baked and each person gets one. The bread is fashioned like a cube with a little top cap. When you pull it off, you can see the steam escaping from within - that's how fresh it is! :) delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Angus House - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Angus House - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Angus House - Singapore, Singapore. Chicken

Nede8h5vyD1ZZ9oKvV1Pqg.text: If your from the US, this is not going to be what you expect from the name. Yeah, they have steaks. But they are small and very expensive. And to be honest, not that good. I've been waiting for three weeks to get home so I can cook my own steak on the grill.

glooRRcMX226qw-NwAKAhg.text: Steak was ... Good. Sides were quite flavourless (I had the greens site fried with garlic). Service was ... accurate.On the whole, the experience was .... adequate. But for the price, I was expecting something significantly more.

itwAB4R_wQ9Q4nvQXbIKJg.text: The ribeye steak was perfect (appx $55SG). The bottle of wine was average. Service staff was polite but not memorable. Seating was okay. View was pretty nice. Love the dinner set. Salad and mushroom soup was also done well (though nothing too special). Overall, worth it =)

8wFuK6OpfTAdd2s-IFE16g.text: Love the Rib-Eye steak set - comes with an appetizer, soup, dinner roll, salad, dessert, in addition to the steak!You can choose whether you want a plain dinner roll or a garlic bread.The juicy steak comes sizzling in a hot plate with the right amount of sauce. We went there a few weeks ago, and the service was top notch, and there were 16 of us!

SKr0iOJ8BcElC4uD2JqbUA.text: Changed a lot for the worse. The last place I'd expect for a very unprofessional way of handling wrongly cooked steak. Instead of grilling a new one, they recooked the steak and overcooked it from a medium rare to a well done, drying up the steak. Was a terrible experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Angus House - Singapore, Singapore. My "medium rare" steak.

lIvZj42ImNu9E30FG71NGA.text: Jap style steaks with miso sauce.Tip: Order your steaks with meat temperature lower than you usually do. a medium rare order usually turn out "medium" due to the hotplace that continues to cook the steak.

zCgM6ZP8ZKbx2GXn_kJU0w.text: Kids wanted steaks after a weekend walkabout around Orchard, so decided to head over to Angus. First time for me although have heard alot of this place. Tug away at a quiet corner of Orchard, its a good place to wind down with family. Went for the rib-eye; overall was OK. Meat was done well to my liking i.e. medium rare; and servings were generous. Enjoyed the dinner because of the quiet dining which is a rarity in Singapore these days.
